0.name: The Entrance to a Crumbling Round Barrow
desc: "   You are standing in the entrance to what looks like an ancient and
long forgotten round barrow.  Above the hole through which you entered is
covered in soil and muck -- a testament to the age of this place.  The
scanty amount of light that penetrates down from the hole reveals the
damp, cracked flagstone floor of a chamber of wrack and ruin -- directly
east part of the ceiling has caved in but, if you dare, you can make
your way around the tumble to the southeast or northeast or you can exit
up back to the bog.

1.name: Inside a Crumbling Round Barrow
desc: "   Debris is everywhere and you are now standing in an inch of fetid
water -- the smell is nauseating.  You can clearly see the signs of the
swamp reclaiming this place.  For a moment you wonder how long this
structure must have been here.  A long time you decide.  The chamber is
blocked by rubble to the south but continues east into darkness or
southwest back to the entrance.

2.name: Inside a Crumbling Round Barrow
desc: "   The stinking, stagnent water of the swamp laps around your ankles and
leaves a dirt-line on your fineries.  This place is a mess.  All around
you the wrack and ruin of the round barrow continues -- fallen stones,
cracked and weathered walls.  You wouldn't be surprised if this place
was to come crashing down you, such is the level of destruction.  You
can continue north or east into darkness or northwest back to the
entrance.

3.name: Inside a Crumbling Round Barrow
desc: "   It is pitch black here and even with your light you stumble and almost
fall on the debris that litters this place.  The swamp is slowly claiming
this structure back -- already the water level covers the tops of your
boots and roots lay hidden under the shallow muck ready to trip you and
other diseased looking tendrils dangle everywhere.  The routes north and
west are blocked by rubble and debris.  To the east you can see light
slanting down from holes in the roof.  You can exit east towards the
light or south into darkness.

4.name: Inside a Crumbling Round Barrow
desc: "   The filthy water is up to your ankles now -- this barrow must be sink-
ing into the bog.  All around you is the destruction of the barrow --
fallen masonry, smashed flag stones and even tiny tiles that must once
have formed a mosaic -- although you can't begin to guess where that
mosaic would have been displayed nor what it could possibly have shown.
Rubble and debris is blocking all routes except north and west. To the
north you can see a faint glimmer of light.  To the west is impenetrable
darkness.

5.name: Inside a Crumbling Round Barrow
desc: "   You carefully pick your way over mounds of stone.  The ceiling is
peppered with holes here and the light beams through them in rays
revealing once lush colours adorning the walls and flagstone floors.  You
try to get a better look but the filthy water of the swamp obscures
everything in the bad light, and already it is lapping at the soles of
your boots -- let's hope it doesn't get any deeper!  You can exit west or
south in to darkness.

6.name: Inside a Crumbling Round Barrow
desc: "   Dirty swamp water licks your ankles.  You notice that the rubble has
formed a tiny opening to the northeast here,  possibly leading to the end
of the round barrow.  What treasures must lay in wait for you there?  To
find out you'll need to brave the muck and mire and continue on in...
You can exit west towards a faint glimmer of light or northeast into
darkness.

7.name: A Dead-end in a Crumbling Round Barrow
desc: "   You are knee deep in muck and gunk, but this part of the chamber is
surprisingly free of debris.  Looking up you see a strong vaulted roof
made of precision-cut granite that looks dry and free of mold.  The walls
on the south, east and north of this chamber are also dry.  As your
fingers touch the wall you feel raised markings beneath your fingers on
the bone-dry surface of the south wall.   Testing with your feet you find
the muck at the bottom of the water is an inch deep and covers a smooth
stoney surface -- its exact composition is not something you want to find
out as that would involve getting down on your knees and immersing
yourself in the festering water.  The routes west and northwest are
blocked by rubble and debris. There is a single exit to the southwest
leading back the way you came.
|                       From chaos comes form,                          |
|                       From more comes less,                           |
|                    From the earth--base to base,                      |
|                       My body, foot and face,                         |
|                 Yet as a hand that moulds and turns,                   |
|               Hammer in hand strikes a smithy spouse,                 |
|          Your hand presses against my shoulder and waist.             |
|                You strike me hot from steely cold,                    |
|                 I bear my horn and 'hardy hole'.                      |

8.name: The Central Burial Chamber
desc: "   You are standing up to your chest in muck and filthy swamp water in a
low roofed chamber.  There is a mere 3 feet of room between the water
level and the ceiling.  The atmosphere reeks of marsh gas and you feel
slightly confined and claustrophobic in here.  Further chambers can be
accessed to the north, west and south, but a mound of rubble and debris
blocks the chamber to the east.  As your light reflects off the wall it
picks out reflective runes that repeat in a pattern around all of the
entrances--perhaps a warning of some kind?  Luckily the fallen rubble is
providing a convenient means of climbing back up to the round barrow.
You can exit north, south and east to other chambers or leave up to the
round barrow.

9.name: The North Burial Chamber
desc: "   You are standing in a dark and enclosed chamber.  Feeling around with
your feet you find the room is strewn with debris, making it perilous to
stand up in.  The water level is almost at your shoulders in here and you
have only a few inches of space above your head.  The darkness and the
smell of the vile swamp water makes this place claustrophobic.  Maybe it
would be best to get out?  There is clearly nothing alive in here. You
can exit south back to the central chamber.

10.name: The West Burial Chamber
desc: "   You are standing in a dark and enclosed chamber.  Feeling around with
your feet you find the room is strewn with debris, making it perilous to
stand up in.  You can also feel what appears to be a ring in the stone of
floor at your feet.  The water level is almost at your shoulders in here
and you have only a few inches of space above your head.  The darkness
and the smell of the vile swamp water makes this place claustrophobic.
Maybe it would be best to get out?  There is clearly nothing alive in
here. You exit east back to the central chamber.
You take a deep breath and plunge under the water...
The ring is made of iron and although it is rusting it is still strong.
You try and pull it but it appears to stuck fast... Feeling around your
fingers trace some runes on the flagstone attached to the ring.
You surface and gasp for air!
You take a deep breath and plunge under the water...
Using your light you manage to illuminate the runes enough to read
them...
"What is the name of the crocodile goddess?"
You surface and gasp for air!

11.name: The South Burial Chamber
desc: "   You are standing in a dark and enclosed chamber.  Feeling around with
your feet you find the room is strewn with debris, making it perilous to
stand up in.  The water level is almost at your shoulders in here and you
have only a few inches of space above your head.  The darkness and the
smell of the vile swamp water makes this place claustrophobic.  Maybe it
would be best to get out?  There is clearly nothing alive in here. You
can exit north back to the central chamber.
The water churns in a great mass of bubbles and a barrow wight explodes
from beneath the swirling surface!

12.name: The South Burial Chamber
desc: "   You are standing in a dark and enclosed chamber.  Feeling around with
your feet you find the room is strewn with debris, making it perilous to
stand up in.  The water level is almost at your shoulders in here and you
have only a few inches of space above your head.  The darkness and the
smell of the vile swamp water makes this place claustrophobic.  Maybe it
would be best to get out?  There is clearly nothing alive in here. You
can exit north back to the central chamber.

13.name: In a small water filled chamber!
desc: "   You are in a very small water filled chamber.  It is so small you can
touch each wall without moving.  You notice a strange rune has been
carved in to each wall and the floor but you can't read what they say.
There is nothing else in here. You can exit up back to the west burial
chamber.
The runes suddenly flare with a light so bright you are briefly blinded.

14.name: An out of body experience?
14.desc: "   All around you is white insubstantial nothingness...

desc: Your vision fades... You feel movement... You arrive somewhere.

15.name: The east burial chamber
desc: "   You are standing in a dry underground chamber with a low roof.  The
walls are plain and unadorned except for the west which is a pile of
rubble and debris.  With a sudden flash of realisation you know that you
are standing in the blocked off east burial chamber of the round barrow.
The rubble has protected this chamber from the swamp -- there is not
even the smallest sign of damp in here... Which means any artefacts that
were placed in the barrow would have been preserved!  You wonder if any
still exist.  There is a sturdy iron ring set into a flagstone in the
floor of the chamber. You can open the flagstone to exit down.

16.name: In a small chamber
desc: "   You are in a very small chamber.  It is so small you can touch each
wall without moving.  You notice a strange rune has been carved in to
each wall and the floor but you can't read what they say.  There is
nothing else in here. You can exit up back to the east burial chamber.
The runes suddenly flare with a light so bright you are briefly blinded.

17.name: An out of body experience?
17.desc: "   All around you is white insubstantial nothingness...

desc: Your vision fades... You feel movement... You arrive somewhere.

18.name: Lost in a Foggy Bog
desc: "   You are standing on a muddy path.  The air is still and damp.  A thick
fog obscures everything more than twenty yards away.  To either side of
the path is thick brackish water.  You daren't test it's depth.  All you
can do is follow the path and hope for the best.  To the north the gate
to the Swamps of Amnos looms with the fog curling thickly to the east and
west of it, providing a barrier between the infected, evil air here and
the relative cleanliness of the swampland to the north.
This gate has been constructed of an unknown material that is cold and harsh
to the touch, as if it somehow wants to stick to you, to infect you.  A nice
design of a frog, that we have come to recognise as the Slaadi overlords of
Dark Horn Hill, has been carved in to the gate and a strange halo of flames
floats an inch or so above it's amphibious head, moving and dancing as if a
breeze blows against the fiery tendrils.  No doubt impressive, maybe it is
also a clue?
Now well known as the Dark Wind, this magically created fog is the will of
the Slaadi, invading and cursing the land, twisting the creatures therein
and possessing all with evil.  The fog is known to seep endlessly from the
Plane of Frogs and provides a crucial life-line for the Slaadi and their
Sahougin minions.  Take care not to breathe too much of it in, for you to
might well succumb to the deadly embrace of the Dark Wind.

exits.info: door, closed, locked, pickproof, autoclose, autolock

19.name: Around the Base of a Low Hill
desc: "   You are standing on a muddy path next to a low hill.  The sides are
slick with dew and it is impossible to climb it at this point.  Maybe
there is another way up further around?  To the other side of the path is
thick brackish water.  You daren't test it's depth.

25.name: Around a Stagnant Pond
desc: "    You are standing on the egde of a stagnant pond.  Swarms of mosquitos
and other bugs plague you.  A ripple emanates from somewhere out in the
centre of the pond, hidden in the fog.  Maybe there is something of
interest out there?  You can wade in to the pond from here if you wish.
You step off the edge of the pond and drop to your waist in fetid water!

26.name: Around a Stagnant Pond
desc: "   You are standing on the egde of a stagnant pond.  Swarms of mosquitos
and other bugs plague you.  A ripple emanates from somewhere out in the
centre of the pond, hidden in the fog.  Maybe there is something of
interest out there?  You think you can see a way to wade in further
around the edge...

27.name: A Path Leading Up a Low Hill
desc: "   The muddy path rises at this point up the low hill.  The fog is ever-
present and you can't see much around you.  Maybe the hill will let you
get above the level of the fog and find get a look at your surroundings?
You start climbing the hill to the north.

28.name: A Path Leading Up a Low Hill
desc: "   The mud on the path has dried now you have risen above the level of
the bog and you find it easier to walk comfortably.  The fog is still
very thick at this level.  You can climb further up the path to the east
or return to the bog to the south.

29.name: A Path Leading Up a Low Hill
desc: "   You are standing on a dry mud path.  The fog is still very thick at
this level.  You can climb further up the path to the north or return
towards the bog to the west.

30.name: A Path Leading Up a Low Hill
desc: "   You are standing on a dry mud path.  The fog is still very thick at
this level.  You can climb further up the path to the north or return
towards the bog to the south.

31.name: A Path Leading Up a Low Hill
desc: "   You are standing on a dry mud path.  The fog is still very thick at

32.name: A Path Leading Up a Low Hill
desc: "   You are standing on a dry mud path.  The fog is still very thick at
this level.  You can climb further up the path to the west or return
towards the bog to the east.

33.name: A Path Leading Up a Low Hill
desc: "   You are standing on a dry mud path.  The fog is has finally started to
show signs of thinning.  Maybe you'll be able to spy out the surroundings
soon!   You can climb further up the path to the south or return
towards the bog to the east.

34.name: A Path Leading Up a Low Hill
desc: "   You are standing on a dry mud path.  The fog is thinning but you still
can't make out any details of your surroundings.  You can climb further
up the path to the south or return towards the bog to the north.

35.name: A Path Leading Up a Low Hill
desc: "   You are standing on a dry mud path.  The fog is thinning but you still
can't make out any details of your surroundings.  You can climb further
up the path to the northeast or return towards the bog to the north.

36.name: The Summit of a Low Hill
desc: "   As you make the final push to the summit, so at last you rise above
the murky fog and out in to clear air.  You can see for miles!  But the
main thing that catches your attention is the massive hill far to the
south, that rises out of the fog like a lone iceberg in a fluffy grey
sea.  You can just make out tiny paths lines snaking across it, leading
to its summit.  Looking around all you see is unmoving fog.  Strange.  It
doesn't appear to be evaporating or anything.  The top of the low hill
you're standing on is dominated by a cairn of stones that stand as tall
as you do, next to which is a large hole, leading down into darkness.

37.name: Lost in a Foggy Bog
desc: "   You are standing on a muddy path.  The air is still and damp.  A thick
fog obscures everything more than twenty yards away.  To either side of
the path is thick brackish water.  You daren't test it's depth.  All you
can do is follow the path and hope for the best.

interest out there?  You can wade in to the pond from here if you wish.
You step off the edge of the pond and drop to your waist in fetid water!

42.name: Wading in a Stagnant Pond
desc: "    You are standing waist deep in a small stagnant pond.  You can feel
the pond life of frogs and toads and other, less savoury things tickling
against your legs.  The water is thick and black the air is full of nasty
biting mosquitos.  You can wade out the same way you waded in.
You struggle and kick your way back the dry(ish) land of the bog!

49.name: Wading in a Stagnant Pond
desc: "    You are standing waist deep in a large stagnant pond.  You can feel
the pond life of frogs and toads and other, less savoury things tickling
against your legs.  The water is thick and black the air is full of nasty
biting mosquitos.  You can wade out the same way you waded in or wade to
deeper water.
You struggle and kick your way back the dry(ish) land of the bog!
You wade further out in to the pond, the water is now at shoulder height!

50.name: Wading in a Stagnant Pond
desc: "    You are standing neck deep in a large stagnant pond.  Your face is
full of mosquitos and other nasty, flying, biting insects.  You can feel
the pond life tickling and touching your body beneath the water and hope
like crazy that some mad newt or eel doesn't decide to take a fancy to
you and use your clothing as a bolt hole.  Your only options are to put
up with the insects and pond life or wade back in to the shallows.
You wade back to the shallows--the water is now at waist height!

88.name: Around the Base of a Strange Mound
desc: "   You are standing on a muddy path next to a a strange mound.  The sides
of the mound are slick with dew and it is impossible to climb it at this
point.  Maybe there is another way up further around?  To the other side
of the path is thick brackish water.  You daren't test it's depth.

93.name: Around the Base of a Strange Mound
desc: "   You are standing on a muddy path next to a a strange mound.  A dry mud
path leads up, onto the mound here.  To the other side of the path is
thick brackish water.  You daren't test it's depth.

94.name: Around the Base of a Strange Mound
desc: "   You are standing on a muddy path next to a a strange mound.  The sides

desc: "   You are standing on a muddy path next to a a strange mound.  The sides

of the path is thick brackish water.  You daren't test it's depth.

97.name: A Path Climbing the Strange Mound
desc: "   You are standing on some relatively dry ground above the level of the
bog.  The fog still obscures your view of the surrounding area.  You can
climb further up the barrow to the west or return to the level of the bog
to the southeast.

98.name: A Path Climbing the Strange Mound
desc: "  You are standing on some dry ground high above the level of the bog.
The fog is thinner here and you can make out some details of the area
surrounding you; to the south-south-west looms a massive hill.  To the
north-north-west looms another, much lower hill.  From here the details
of both are reduced to dark shadows in a smudgy-grey blanket.  You can
continue to climb up the barrow to the west or climb down to the east.

99.name: The Summit of the Strange Mound
desc: "   You are standing on top of a strange round barrow.  The bog below is
obscured by the thick blanket of fog, which peaks just above your head.
Jumping up and down you manage to raise yourself above the highest wisps
and look around.  The surrounding land is hidden under a covering of fog
so thick you could use it for Soup.  Far to the south-south-west a massive
hill climbs out of the fog; you can make out a path snaking around its
green sides and occasionally a glint of light reflecting here and there
on its surface.  Closer to you, to the north-north-west you can make out
the top of a low hill just peeking over the fog bank; there is a structure
of some sorts on its crest.  Unfortunately you can't make out how far
the fog extends due to not being able to rise high enough.  In the ground
at your feet there is a hole cut in the turf of the barrow that leads
down in to darkness.  You can exit down to the barrow to the east.
You jump up and down madly for a while.  The glints of light from the big
hill could be made from light reflecting off a metal or glass surface, but
that's all you can make out.
You jump and down madly for a while.  The structure on the low hill could
be made of stones piled one on top of the other, but you're just too far
away to be sure.

100.name: Around a Stagnant Pond
desc: "   You are standing on the egde of a stagnant pond.  Swarms of mosquitos
and other bugs plague you.  A ripple emanates from somewhere out in the
centre of the pond, hidden in the fog.  Maybe there is something of
interest out there?  You think you can see a way to wade in further
around the edge...

101.name: Around a Stagnant Pond
desc: "    You are standing on the egde of a stagnant pond.  Swarms of mosquitos
and other bugs plague you.  A ripple emanates from somewhere out in the
centre of the pond, hidden in the fog.  Maybe there is something of
interest out there?  You can wade in to the pond from here if you wish.
You step off the edge of the pond and drop to your waist in fetid water!

102.name: Wading in a Stagnant Pond
desc: "    You are standing waist deep in a large stagnant pond.  You can feel
the pond life of frogs and toads and other, less savoury things tickling
against your legs.  The water is thick and black the air is full of nasty
biting mosquitos.  You can wade out the same way you waded in or wade to
deeper water.
You wade further out in to the pond, the water is now at shoulder height!
You struggle and kick your way back the dry(ish) land of the bog!

103.name: Wading in a Stagnant Pond
desc: "    You are standing neck deep in a large stagnant pond.  Your face is
full of mosquitos and other nasty, flying, biting insects.  You can feel
the pond life tickling and touching your body beneath the water and hope
like crazy that some mad newt or eel doesn't decide to take a fancy to
you and use your clothing as a bolt hole.  Your only options are to put
up with the insects and pond life or wade back in to the shallows.
You wade back to the shallows--the water is now at waist height!

interest out there?  You think you can see a way to wade in further

158.name: A Path Up Dark Horn Hill
desc: "   The gravel path crunches under your feet as you climb.  You would have
to be nimble indeed not to make any noise on this surface!  the fog is as
thick here as it was below.  You can continue up to the northwest or down
to the southeast.

159.name: A Path Up Dark Horn Hill
desc: "   The gravel path crunches under your feet as you climb.  You would have
to be nimble indeed not to make any noise on this surface!  the fog is as
thick here as it was below.  You can continue up to the west or down to
the southeast.

160.name: A Path Up Dark Horn Hill
desc: "   The gravel path crunches under your feet as you climb.  You would have
to be nimble indeed not to make any noise on this surface!  The fog has
started to thin now, although looking down you can no longer make out the
base of the hill or the bog.  Perhaps shortly you will rise above the
level of the mire and make out your surroundings.  You can continue up to
the north or down to the east.

161.name: A Path Up Dark Horn Hill
desc: "   Wow!  Even the crunching of the gravel path has been forgotten.  You
had no idea that some sights could be so beautiful.  You have risen above
the level of the fog and you're now standing waist deep in the billowing
mists.  All around the fog stretches out as far as you can see. Far to
the north you can make out a small hillock rising like a whale taking a
breath.  To the east the sheer sides of Dark Horn Hill rise and, as you
look up, you grasp that you are still very low down on the massive grass
covered hill.  Much more climbing lays ahead of you if you are to reach
the summit.  A glint of light from further up the slope and brief flurry
of gravel landing ahead on the path gives you cause for concern.

162.name: A Path Up Dark Horn Hill
desc: "   The gravel path crunches under your feet as you climb.  You would have
to be nimble indeed not to make any noise on this surface!  Looking down
you can see the fog lies like a blanket over the bog and looking out and
across the land you think you make out an edge to the strangely unmoving
mire that has obscured your view for so long.  To the north you can just
make out a small hillock, its peak just rising out of the thick mists.
You can continue up to the east or down to the south.

163.name: A Path Up Dark Horn Hill
desc: "   The gravel path crunches under your feet as you climb.  You would have

desc: "   The gravel path crunches under your feet as you climb.  You would have
to be nimble indeed not to make any noise on this surface!  Looking down

across the land you can finally make out an edge to the strange unmoving

To the north you can see the low hillock poking up the level of the fog.
You can continue up to the east or down to the southwest.

The view to the north is obscured again. You can continue up to the west

181.name: A Path Up Dark Horn Hill
desc: "   The gravel path crunches under your feet as you climb.  You would have
to be nimble indeed not to make any noise on this surface!  Looking down

across the land you can finally make out an edge to the strange unmoving
mire that has obscured your view for so long.  But what you can tell is
if its moving at all, or evaporating.  You would need to climb higher.
The view to the north is obscured again. You can continue up to the north
west or down to the east.

182.name: A Path Up Dark Horn Hill
desc: "   The gravel path crunches under your feet as you climb.  You would have
to be nimble indeed not to make any noise on this surface!  Looking down
you can see the fog lies like a blanket over the bog and looking out and
across the land you can finally make out an edge to the strange unmoving
mire that has obscured your view for so long.  But what you can tell is
if its moving at all, or evaporating.  The summit is almost within reach
now, a little more and you'll be able to survey everything. To the north
and far below you the little hillock rises out the sea of fog like a fish
in a lake. You can continue up to the east or down to the southeast.

183.name: A Path Up Dark Horn Hill
desc: "   The gravel path crunches under your feet as you climb.  You would have
to be nimble indeed not to make any noise on this surface!  Looking down
you can see the fog lies like a blanket over the bog and looking out and
across the land you can finally make out an edge to the strange unmoving
mire that has obscured your view for so long.  But what you can tell is
if its moving at all, or evaporating.  The summit is almost within reach
now, a little more and you'll be able to survey everything. To the north
and far below you the little hillock rises out the sea of fog like a fish
in a lake. You can continue up to the east or down to the west.

184.name: The Summit of Dark Horn Hill
desc: "   The gravel path crunches under your feet as you finally make it to the
summit of Dark Horn Hill.  Looking down and all around you can see that
the fog lies like a perfect circular blanket over the bog.  The edges,
which are now crisp to your vision, are unmoving and nowhere can you make
out signs of evaporation or billowing due to wind.  You finally come to
the conclusion that this fog is unnatural. Below your feet is a stone
block covered in carvings.  The gravel around the stone looks like it has
been disturbed recently.  You can head back down the hill to the west.
The gravel looks like it has been moved around the block.  Almost as if
the block has been lifted and placed back down...  An opening perhaps?

exits.info: door, closed, locked, secret, autoclose, autolock, pickproof

185.name: A Passage Inside Dark Horn Hill
desc: "   You are standing in a stone-lined stairway.  Above, the way out has
closed and everything is in total darkness; you're glad you brought your
torch with you!  The stairs are steep but neatly cut, and a rut in the
centre of them indicates much use over many, many years.  You can follow
the stairs down into darkness.

186.name: A Passage Inside Dark Horn Hill
desc: "   You are standing in a stone-lined stairway.  Everything is in total
darkness; you're glad you brought your torch with you!  The stairs are
steep but neatly cut, and a rut in the centre of them indicates much use
over many, many years.  You can follow the stairs up or down.

187.name: A Passage Inside Dark Horn Hill
desc: "   You are standing at the base of a stone-lined stairway.  Everything is
in total darkness; you're glad you brought your torch with you!  The
stairs end here and a stone-lined passage way leads north.  The stone wall
to the south is covered in panels depicting strangely angular lizards that
walk upright and all but one seems to have a theme of fog.  The odd one
depicts a lizardman bypassing some strange monster than is eating all of
the other lizards that try and pass it. Odd indeed.
You open the panel and squeeze and crawl your way in.

exits.info: door, closed, secret, message, autoclose, locked, autolock, pickproof

188.name: A Passage Inside Dark Horn Hill
desc: "   You are standing at in a stone-lined passageway.  Everything is in
total darkness; you're glad you brought your torch with you!  The passage
leads south and west.

189.name: A Passage Inside Dark Horn Hill
desc: "   You are standing at the top of a stone-lined stairway.  Everything is
in total darkness; you're glad you brought your torch with you!  The
stairs start here and a stone-lined passage way leads east.  There is an
odd smell in the air here.  Something warm, yet rotten.  You get a bad
feeling.

190.name: A Secret Passage
desc: "   You are crawling in a narrow passage that is just big enough to admit
you.  No one else could fit in here.  The passage is lined with squared
off blocks of stone.  You can continue east or back through the secret
panel to the north.
You squeeze and crawl your way along.
You open the panel and drop gracelessly to the ground.

191.name: A Secret Passage
desc: "   You are crawling in a narrow passage that is just big enough to admit
you.  No one else could fit in here.  The passage is lined with squared
off blocks of stone.  You can continue down or west.
You squeeze and crawl your way along.
You squeeze and crawl your way along.

192.name: Lair of the Blue Slaad
desc: "   You are standing in a large, circular chamber. A set of stairs lead up
and down.  Torches line the walls here and cast light around the chamber.
This is not good.  The floor is littered with old bones an ancient fish
remains.  There is even signs of lizardman remains in the carnage.  There
is a crunch of bone and a booming footfall...  Uh oh!

194.name: A Secret Passage
desc: "   You are crawling in a narrow passage that is just big enough to admit
you.  No one else could fit in here.  The passage is lined with squared
off blocks of stone.  You can continue down or up.
You squeeze and crawl your way along.
You squeeze and crawl your way along.

195.name: A Secret Passage
desc: "   You are crawling in a narrow passage that is just big enough to admit
you.  No one else could fit in here.  The passage is lined with squared
off blocks of stone.  You can continue up or open the secret panel to the
northwest.
You squeeze and crawl your way along.
You open the panel and drop gracelessly to the ground.

196.name: A Passage Inside Dark Horn Hill
desc: "   You are standing in a stone-lined stairway.  Everything is in total
darkness; you're glad you brought your torch with you!  The stairs are
steep but neatly cut, and a rut in the centre of them indicates much use
over many, many years.  There is a stone-lined passageway leading south-
east. You can follow the stairs up or down.

197.name: A Passage Inside Dark Horn Hill
desc: "   The square-cut stairs end and another stone-lined passage leads of to
the southeast.  There is a smell of damp in the air here, but it isn't
cold.  If anything, it is quite warm down here.

198.name: A Passage Inside Dark Horn Hill
desc: "   You are standing at a dead end in a stone-lined passagewat.  Everything
is in total darkness; you're glad you brought your torch with you!  The
stone-lined passage way leads north.  The stone wall to the southeast is
covered in panels depicting strangely angular lizards that walk upright
and all but one seems to have a theme of fog.  The odd one depicts a
lizardman bypassing some strange monster that is eating all of the other
lizards that try and pass it. Odd indeed.
You open the panel and squeeze and crawl your way in.

199.name: Entrance to the Gnoll Den
desc: "   You are standing at the bottom of a crude stairway that has been cut
into the hill.  The tunnel here is crude but stable.  There is a smell of
wet dog in the air.

200.name: In the Gnoll Den
desc: "   You are standing in a crude but stable tunnel.  There is a smell of wet
dog in the air.

201.name: In the Gnoll Den
desc: "   You are standing in a crude but stable tunnel.  There is a smell of wet
dog in the air.

202.name: In the Gnoll Den
desc: "   A crude table dominates this chamber.  On the the table is a map of the
bogs surrounding this hill.  Marked on the map are several large crosses
in red and some indecipherable markings...  Maybe this marks out the
battles the gnolls have had with the lizardmen and other invaders into
their territory?

203.name: In the Gnoll Den
desc: "   You are standing in a crude but stable tunnel.  There is a smell of wet
dog in the air.

204.name: In the Gnoll Den
desc: "   You are standing in a crude but stable tunnel.  There is a smell of wet
dog in the air.

205.name: In the Gnoll Den
desc: "   The smell of wet dog and other unpleasant odours fills the air here.
There is a sense of pack and family in this chamber.  Almost as if gnolls
throughout the generations have raised their pups in here.

206.name: In the Gnoll Den
desc: "   The smell of wet dog and other unpleasant odours fills the air here.
There is a sense of pack and family in this chamber.  Almost as if gnolls
throughout the generations have raised their pups in here.

207.name: In the Gnoll Den
desc: "   This is a guard post, cunningly positioned to allow the guard quick
access to the tunnel beyond.  There is a crude straw and leaf mattress
on the floor and some gnawed bones litter the floor.
